com.qtfx.lib.db

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Filter.Segment>
          • com.qtfx.lib.db.Filter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Filter.Segment>, Collection<Filter.Segment>, List<Filter.Segment>, RandomAccess

    public class Filter
extends ArrayList<Filter.Segment>
    Filters are used to build complex WHERE clauses programmatic. Filters chain expressions with logical conditions and brackets to form complex WHERE clauses.

    Note that the features in filters are not aimed to provide a full SQL compatible set, but to offer a useful enough sub-set compatible with as much databases as possible.

    Author:
    Miquel Sas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • condSimple

        public void condSimple(Field field,
                       String condition,
                       Value value)
        Add a simple comparison condition to the filter. Valid conditions are EQ, GT, GE, LT, LE or NE.
        Parameters:
        field - The left expression is a field.
        condition - The condition, either EQ, GT, GE, LT, LE or NE.
        value - The right expression is a single value.

      • condSimpleNoCase

                             String condition,

        Parameters:

        condition - The condition, either EQ, GT, GE, LT, LE or NE.
        value - The right expression is a single value.

      • condSimple

        private void condSimple(Field field,
                        String condition,
                        Value value,
                        boolean nocase)
        Add a simple comparison condition to the filter. Valid conditions are EQ, GT, GE, LT, LE or NE.
        Parameters:
        field - The left expression is a field.
        condition - The condition, either EQ, GT, GE, LT, LE or NE.
        value - The right expression is a single value.
        nocase - A boolean to indicate if the condition should be case insensitive.

      • condGroup

        public void condGroup(Field field,
                      String condition,
                      String group,
                      List<Value> values)
        Add a group comparison condition to the filter, where the left expression is a field and the right expression is a value expression list. Valid conditions are EQ, GE, GT, LE, LT and NE. Valid group modifiers are ANY, SOME and ALL.
        Parameters:
        field - The left expression is a field.
        condition - The condition, either EQ, GE, GT, LE, LT or NE.
        group - The group modifier, either ANY, SOME or ALL.
        values - The right expression is a value expression list.
